sentence.Network_en: He became very withdrawn and broody.
I reached the age of 27 and suddenly started to feel broody.

sentence.Network_en: Why are you so broody today?

entry.def: You say that someone is broody when they are thinking a lot about something in an unhappy way.

example.ex: He became very withdrawn and broody.

entry.def: A broody hen is ready to lay or sit on eggs.
If you describe a young woman as broody, you mean that she wants to have a baby and she keeps thinking about it.

means.word_mean: 1. a domestic hen ready to brood

auth_sentence.content: It's one of the tidier ditties, alongside the Casio chug of Dutch Me and the broody, oddly moving Big Mistake.

auth_sentence.content: Closely following that Violence is a broody master class in barren, glitchy beats which picks up the album's pace.
